contentrichtext.text: {{Other places}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Wyszków | image_skyline = Wyszkow idzi.JPG | imagesize = 250px | image_caption = Church in Wyszków | image_flag = POL Wyszków flag.svg | image_shield = POL Wyszków COA.svg | pushpin_map = Poland | pushpin_label_position = bottom | coordinates_region = PL | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{POL}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Masovian Voivodeship|Masovian]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Powiat|County]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Wyszków County]] | subdivision_type3 = [[Gmina]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Gmina Wyszków]] | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = Grzegorz Nowosielski | established_title = Established | established_date = 13th century | established_title3 = Town rights | established_date3 = 1502 | area_total_km2 = 20.78 | population_as_of = 2006 | population_total = 27010 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] | utc_offset = +1 | timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] | utc_offset_DST = +2 | latd = 52 | latm = 35 | lats = 36 | latNS = N | longd = 21 | longm = 27 | longs = 36 | longEW = E | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 07-200, 07-202 | area_code = +48 029 | blank_name = [[Polish car number plates|Car plates]] | blank_info = WWY | website = http://www.wyszkow.pl }} '''Wyszków''' {{IPAc-pl|'|w|y|sz|k|u|f}} is a town in northeastern [[Poland]] with 26,500 inhabitants (2003). It is the capital of [[Wyszków County]] ({{lang-pl|powiat wyszkowski}}). Wyszków is in the [[Masovian Voivodeship]] (since 1999); previously it was in the [[Warsaw Voivodeship]] (until 1975) and the [[Ostrołęka Voivodeship]] (1975–1998). ==Description== The village of Wyszków was first documented in 1203. The town was founded in 1502. It was destroyed during the [[Second Northern War]] in 1655-1660, when it lost its significance in the region. Industry developed after 1897, when the Pilawa-Tluszcz-[[Ostrołęka]] railway was built. ==Jews in Wyszków== Before World War II half of Wyszków's population of 9,000 were [[Jew]]ish; after the war there were none. On 14 September 1997 a memorial to [[Holocaust]] victims was unveiled in Wyszków. It is made of reclaimed Jewish gravestones that had been removed from the site in 1939 by German forces, who used them as paving stones and to build the local [[Gestapo]] headquarters. Scores of these desecrated tombstones were recovered and incorporated as part of the monument. Wyszków was the birthplace of [[Mordechaj Anielewicz]] in 1919. == Notable people from Wyszków == * [[Mordechaj Anielewicz]], leader of the [[Warsaw Ghetto Uprising]] [[File:Wyszkow-Anielewicz memorial.jpg|thumb|Monument to Mordechaj Anielewicz in Wyszków]] * [[Jarosław Kalinowski]] {{Commons category|Wyszków}} ==External links== * [http://www.sztetl.org.pl/en/city/wyszkow/ Jewish Community in Wyszków] on Virtual Shtetl * [http://www.wyszkow.com.pl/ Portal Wyszkow] {{Wyszków County}} {{Gmina Wyszków}} {{coord|52|35|36|N|21|27|36|E|region:PL_type:city|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wyszkow}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Masovian Voivodeship]] [[Category:Wyszków County]] {{Masovian-geo-stub}}
